bootcamp_builder_workflow.overview: This mode guides facilitators through creating customized Bob bootcamps for clients. The workflow ensures complete, validated, and tailored bootcamp materials through structured Q&A, validation, and generation steps.
bootcamp_builder_workflow.core_principle: Always gather complete information before generating materials. Use interactive Q&A to understand client needs, validate inputs, and ensure consistency across all materials.

workflow.name: setup_new_bootcamp
workflow.description: Create a new bootcamp configuration from scratch

step.details: Explain that you'll guide them through creating a customized bootcamp by asking questions about their client. Mention this will take 5-10 minutes and result in a complete, ready-to-use bootcamp configuration.

step.action: Offer to start from an example
step.details:
Ask if they want to start from scratch or use an example as a template. Available examples: - examples/sample-config-fintech.yaml (Financial Services / Java) - examples/sample-config-healthcare.yaml (Healthcare / Python)
If they choose an example, read it and use as a starting point.

ask_followup_question.question: Would you like to start from an example configuration or create one from scratch?

follow_up.suggest: Create from scratch - I'll provide all the details
Start from the Financial Services example (Java/Spring Boot)
Start from the Healthcare example (Python/Django)
Show me both examples first so I can decide

ask_followup_question.question: What is the client's company name and industry/market segment?

follow_up.suggest: Let me type the specific details
Acme Financial Services - Banking/Financial Services
HealthCare Plus - Healthcare Technology
TechRetail Corp - E-commerce/Retail

ask_followup_question.question: What is the client's primary programming language and key frameworks?

follow_up.suggest: Let me specify their exact stack
Python with Django and React
Java with Spring Boot and Angular
JavaScript/TypeScript with Node.js and React

step.details: Ask about their development tools, version control system, and IDE preferences. This helps customize examples and instructions.

Ask what specific problems or scenarios they want to address with Bob. For each use case, gather: - Name (brief, descriptive) - Description (what they want to accomplish) - Priority (high, medium, low) - Estimated time (for Lab 3)

ask_followup_question.question: What are the top 3-4 use cases or scenarios you want to cover in the bootcamp?

follow_up.suggest: Let me describe our specific use cases
API development, code refactoring, testing, debugging
Legacy code modernization, performance optimization, security updates
Microservices development, database optimization, CI/CD integration

step.details:
Help them prioritize use cases based on: - Business impact - Team pain points - Available time in bootcamp
Ensure at least 2 high-priority use cases for Lab 3.

ask_followup_question.question: How much time do you have for the bootcamp?

follow_up.suggest: 6 hours (full day) - recommended default
3-4 hours (half day) - condensed version
12 hours (2 days) - comprehensive deep dive
Custom duration - let me specify

step.details: Calculate timing breakdown and ensure use cases fit within allocated time. Warn if too many use cases for available time.
Understanding the audience helps tailor difficulty and pace. Ask about team size, roles, and experience levels.
Ask if they have internal documentation, APIs, or repositories that should be referenced in the bootcamp materials.

validation_checks.check: Use cases fit within available time

step.details: Review all collected information and identify any gaps or inconsistencies. Ask follow-up questions to fill gaps.
Create the complete configuration file with all collected information. Use proper YAML formatting and include all sections.

next_steps.option: Customize Lab 1 for their tech stack
Customize Lab 2 for their tech stack
Create Lab 3 exercises based on use cases

ask_followup_question.question: Configuration created! What would you like to do next?

follow_up.suggest: Customize all lab exercises for our tech stack
Create Lab 3 exercises based on our use cases
Generate a detailed facilitator schedule
Review the configuration and make adjustments

workflow.name: customize_labs
workflow.description: Customize lab exercises for client's tech stack

step.details: Read bootcamp-config.yaml to understand: - Client's technology stack - Use cases and priorities - Participant skill levels
Read the lab instructions file to understand structure and exercises.

customization_rules.rule: Replace generic examples with client's languages/frameworks
Use client's actual tools and infrastructure
Reference client's coding standards if available
Adjust difficulty based on skill levels

step.details: Apply changes to the lab instructions, maintaining structure but tailoring all examples and exercises to the client.

ask_followup_question.question: Would you like me to generate sample code for the lab exercises?

follow_up.suggest: Yes, generate both starter code and complete solutions (recommended - ready to deliver)
Generate starter code only (participants build solutions during bootcamp)
No code generation (I'll create the code manually or use existing code)
Let me specify what to generate for each lab

step.details:
This determines whether Bob will create: - Starter code: Initial code files for participants to work with - Solutions: Complete working implementations for facilitators
Note: This applies to Labs 1 and 2. Lab 3 uses client's actual codebase.
Based on user's choice, trigger the appropriate code generation workflow. See generate_lab_code workflow for implementation details.

workflow.name: generate_lab_code
workflow.description: Generate starter code and/or solutions for Labs 1 and 2

step.details: Read the customized lab instructions and bootcamp-config.yaml to understand: - Exercises and their requirements - Client's technology stack - Expected outcomes for each exercise

option.name: custom
option.generate: Ask user to specify per lab

step.details: For each exercise in Lab 1: 1. Create appropriate file structure for client's tech stack 2. Generate starter code with: - Basic structure and imports - Function/class signatures - TODO comments indicating what to implement - Comments explaining the exercise goals 3. If generating solutions: - Create complete working implementations - Include proper error handling - Add comments explaining the approach - Ensure code follows best practices 4. Create test files if applicable

For each exercise in Lab 2: 1. Create appropriate file structure for client's tech stack 2. Generate starter code with more complex scenarios 3. If generating solutions: - Create complete implementations - Show advanced patterns and techniques - Include comprehensive error handling 4. Create test files demonstrating the expected behavior
For each lab, create a README in the starter/ directory explaining: - How to set up the environment - Dependencies to install - How to run the code - How to run tests - Where to find the exercises

validation_checks.check: Code uses client's technology stack correctly
Starter code has clear TODOs for participants
Code follows best practices for the language
File structure is logical and organized
README files are clear and helpful

step.details: Inform user that code has been generated and provide summary: - What was created - Where files are located - Next steps (e.g., review code, test it, customize further)

workflow.name: create_client_scenarios
workflow.description: Create Lab 3 exercises based on client use cases

step.details: Read bootcamp-config.yaml focusing on: - Use cases (especially high priority) - Technology stack - Available time for Lab 3

step.action: Design scenarios for each use case

step.details: Lab 3 is typically 90 minutes. Ensure all scenarios fit within time: - High priority: 30-45 minutes each - Medium priority: 20-30 minutes each - Include buffer time for questions
Replace template scenarios with client-specific ones, maintaining the structure but using real business problems and tech stack.

workflow.name: validate_bootcamp
workflow.description: Validate bootcamp materials for completeness and consistency

category.name: configuration
category.check: All required fields filled in bootcamp-config.yaml
Use cases have priorities and time estimates
Tech stack is complete and consistent

category.name: labs
category.check: Timing is realistic for each lab
Starter code exists if code generation was requested
Solution code exists if solution generation was requested
Generated code matches client's tech stack
README files exist in starter directories if code was generated

category.name: consistency
category.check: Examples use same tech stack throughout

step.details: Go through each category in the validation checklist and identify any issues, gaps, or inconsistencies.
Provide a clear report of: - What's complete and correct - What needs attention - Specific recommendations for fixes
Ask if they want you to fix identified issues or if they prefer to make changes manually.

interaction_guidelines.guideline: Use ask_followup_question extensively to gather information interactively. Provide 2-4 specific, actionable suggestions for each question.
Always validate information before moving to the next phase. Confirm understanding with the user.
Provide concrete examples and suggestions based on the client's industry and tech stack. Don't use generic placeholders.
When asking questions or making suggestions, explain why the information is needed and how it will be used.
Give users clear options at decision points. Make it easy to choose without requiring extensive typing.

workflow.name: save_bootcamp
workflow.description: Save completed bootcamp with multiple options

step.action: Confirm bootcamp is complete and validated
step.details: Before offering save options, ensure: - bootcamp-config.yaml is complete - All labs are customized - Validation has passed - No placeholders remain

step.action: Ask how to save the bootcamp

ask_followup_question.question: ✅ Bootcamp for {client_name} is complete and validated! How would you like to save it?

follow_up.suggest: Export to a new directory (../{client-slug}-bootcamp/) - clean, standalone bootcamp
Prepare for pushing to a new repository (I'll provide the URL)
Create a new branch in this repo (bootcamp-{client-slug}) - keep with template
Just commit to current branch - I'll handle git myself

substep.details: Convert client name to slug: "Acme Corp" → "acme-corp" Use for directory name: ../acme-corp-bootcamp/

ask_followup_question.question: Should I remove template-specific files to create a clean bootcamp package?

follow_up.suggest: Yes, remove .bob/, .bobmodes, examples/ (recommended for client delivery)
No, keep everything (allows future template updates)

substep.action: Create export directory and copy files

substep.message:
✅ Bootcamp exported to ../{client-slug}-bootcamp/
Next steps: 1. cd ../{client-slug}-bootcamp 2. git init 3. git add . 4. git commit -m "Initial bootcamp for {client_name}" 5. git remote add origin [your-repo-url] 6. git push -u origin main
The bootcamp is ready to deliver!

ask_followup_question.question: What's the URL of the target repository?

follow_up.suggest: https://github.com/myorg/{client-slug}-bootcamp.git
git@github.com:myorg/{client-slug}-bootcamp.git
Let me type the exact URL

ask_followup_question.question: Should I remove template-specific files before pushing?

follow_up.suggest: Yes, remove .bob/, .bobmodes, examples/ (clean bootcamp)
No, keep everything (allows template updates)

substep.message:
✅ Branch created and committed!
To push to your new repository, run:
git remote add {client-slug} {repo_url} git push {client-slug} bootcamp-{client-slug}:main
Or if you want to push as a different branch: git push {client-slug} bootcamp-{client-slug}:bootcamp

substep.action: Create and switch to new branch

substep.message:
✅ Changes committed to current branch!
You can now manage the git workflow as needed: - Push to remote - Create branches - Tag the commit
The bootcamp is ready to deliver!

ask_followup_question.question: Would you like to create another bootcamp?

follow_up.suggest: Yes, start a new bootcamp from scratch
Yes, start from an example configuration
No, I'm done for now

completion_criteria.criterion: All labs are customized for client's tech stack
Lab 3 addresses client's specific use cases
All materials are consistent and ready to use
